00055     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00056     /// @namespace phys::xml
00057     /// @brief The components to load, save, modify, and use XML will be stored here

00059     /// manipulating xml documents will reside. This components found here are simply
00060     /// a tight wrapper around TinyXMLcpp with some integration with the rest of the
00061     /// physgame engine to allow some enhanced functionality (like using Ogre's nifty
00062     /// File loading system).\n

00100     namespace xml
00101     {
00102         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00103         /// @class Base
00104         /// @headerfile xmlbase.h
00105         /// @brief A set of all functionality that all XML components must implement
00106         /// @details All XML components inherit from this. This is the most basic level
00107         /// of functionality that all XML components will implement
00108         class Base
00109         {
00110             protected:
00111                 /// @internal
00112                 /// @brief A pointer to the Library level object we are wrapping to implement this functionality
00113                 ticpp::Base* Wrapped;
00114 
00115             public:
00116 
00117 
00118                 /// @brief This is used to identify what kind of component you are working with, in conjunction with the GetType() function
00119                 enum XMLComponentType
00120                 {
00121                     isAttribute,              /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is an attribute, and not a node */
00122                     isNode,                   /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and nothing else */
00123                     isComment,                /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and */
00124                     isDeclaration,            /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and */
00125                     isDocument,               /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and */
00126                     isElement,                /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and */
00127                     isStyleSheetReference,    /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and */
00128                     isText,                   /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and */
00129                     isUnknown                 /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and */
00130                 };
00131 
00132                 /// @brief This Will be by Child classes to aid in identification
00133                 /// @return Classes that inherit from this are expected to return an XMLComponentType that indicates what kind of XML component they are.
00134                 virtual XMLComponentType GetType() = 0;
00135 
00136                 /// @brief Return the position, in the original source file, of this node or attribute.
00137                 /// @details Return the position, in the original source file, of this node or attribute. The row and column are 1-based.
00138                 /// (That is the first row and first column is 1,1). If the returns values are 0 or less, then the parser does not have
00139                 /// a row and column value. \n \n
00140                 /// Generally, the row and column value will be set when the Document::Load(), Document::LoadFile(), or any Node::Parse()
00141                 /// is called. It will NOT be set when the DOM was created from operator>>. \n \n
00142                 /// The values reflect the initial load. Once the DOM is modified programmatically (by adding or changing nodes and
00143                 /// attributes) the new values will NOT update to reflect changes in the document. \n \n
00144                 /// There is a minor performance cost to computing the row and column. Computationcan be disabled if
00145                 /// Document::SetTabSize() is called with 0 as the value.
00146                 /// @return Returns an int.
00147                 int Row() const;
00148 
00149                 /// @brief Return the position, in the original source file, of this node or attribute.
00150                 /// @details See Row()
00151                 /// @return Returns an int.
00152                 int Column() const;
00153 
00154                 // @brief Set a pointer to arbitrary user data.
00155                 // @param user This can be a pointer to any data that is required.
00156                 // @details Sometimes it is too useful to be able to apply extras information, this seems to be the most appropriate place for that functionality.
00157                 //void SetUserData (void *user);
00158                 // @brief Get a pointer to arbitrary user data.
00159                 // @details Returns gibberish (not always 0) if SetUserData was not called. Could be invalid, or not, make sure that you set it if you plan on
00160                 // using it, and set See SetUserData(void*) .
00161                 // @return This returns a pointer to something, it is up to you (or the game programmer) to determine what that means.
00162                 //void* GetUserData();
00163                 // @brief See GetUserData()
00164                 //const void* GetUserData () const;
00165 
00166                 /// @brief Equality comparison operation based on internal data
00167                 /// @param OtherBase Another XML object that will be compared
00168                 /// @details Compare internal TiXml pointers to determine if both are wrappers around the same node.
00169                 /// @return A bool containing true if the internal pointers match
00170                 bool operator== (const Base &OtherBase) const;
00171 
00172                 /// @brief Inquality comparison operation based on internal data
00173                 /// @param OtherBase Another XML object that will be compared
00174                 /// @details Compare internal TiXml pointers to determine if both are wrappers around the same node.
00175                 /// @return A bool containing false if the internal pointers match
00176                 bool operator!= (const Base &OtherBase) const;
00177 
00178 
00179                 /// @brief Used to get details about issues suitable for the the user or detailed logs
00180                 /// @details Builds detailed error string using TiXmlDocument::Error() and others.
00181                 /// @return This returns a string that contains the current error information [I think that is what happens anyway.]
00182                 String BuildDetailedErrorString() const;
00183 
00184                 /// @brief A simple empty virtual destructor for compatibility and ease of customization.
00185                 virtual ~Base();
00186 
00187         }; // /Base
00188     }// /xml
00189 }// /phys
00190 
00191 /// @brief Streaming output operator for XML Documents
00192 /// @details This converts the data of an XML Document into a stream Ideal for sending to a log or cout
00193 /// @param stream This is the stream we send our data to.
00194 /// @return This returns an std::ostream which now contains our data.
00195 std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& stream, const phys::xml::Base& x);
